raw_response:
Banana Bolo, as a Tunisian Jewish Djerban sweet cake, typically appears as a moist, tender-textured cake with a lightly golden to warm brown crust, reflecting its sweet, spiced nature. Since it is a cake rather than a stew or soup, its consistency is solid but moist with a soft crumb, achieved in vegan adaptations by using mashed bananas and applesauce instead of eggs.

When served, Banana Bolo is usually presented in slices on a plate rather than in a bowl, appropriate for Shabbat breakfast or
